headline: What Wall Street's top CEOs are saying about tariff impacts
summary: Uncertainty about US President Trump's tariff policies has created a difficult environment for corporate America to make business decisions. Watch the video above to hear what some of the top CEOs on Wall Street, including Whirlpool (WHR) CEO Marc Bitzer, Southwest Airlines (LUV) CEO Bob Jordan, Chipotle (CMG) CEO Scott Boatwright, T-Mobile (TMUS) CEO Mike Sievert, and Procter & Gamble (PG) CEO Jon Moeller have told Yahoo Finance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: The Score: Tesla, Capital One, Boeing and More Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: Elon Musk  is planning more time at  Tesla  less time in the White House.  During Tesla’s earnings call, the billionaire chief executive talked about his plans to pull back from the Department of Government Efficiency, saying that he expects to continue spending “a day or two” each week on government matters.  Musk’s controversial work with the Trump administration and his political endorsements have weighed on Tesla demand and led to protests and vandalism at Tesla showrooms.

headline: RBC upgrades Tide detergent maker P&G on buying opportunity after outlook cut
summary: Investing.com -- RBC Capital Markets upgraded Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) Co stock to "Outperform" from "Sector Perform" saying the recent pullback in stock a buying opportunity. Brokerage added that the earnings reset and long-term strategic investments position it well despite near-term challenges.RBC also raised its price target on P&G stock to $177 from $164 per share.
